About Me

Hello.

Web Development

Full Stack Web Developer

I began studying web development a year ago as a self-learner. I signed up with a Team Treehouse account, started designing my first website, 'DroneBug360' within just a few weeks, and began diving further into self-study of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript upon completing my first website and uploading new content. As I began uploading more and more content, I became fascinated with how content was displayed and interacted with online and decided to further my Web Dev education by attending a coding bootcamp, DevMountain, in the city of Provo, Utah.

Drone Bug 360

Founder, Drone Pilot, Chief Editor

I'm an FAA certified drone pilot. In early 2018, I started a drone business with aim of providing quality aerial photographs and videos for local businesses.

Drone Bug 360, LLC is an aerial photography and videography business aimed to provide high quality, aerial videos and images based in Mooresville, North Carolina. In addition to providing standard HD aerial photographs and videos like most other drone businesses, DB360 specializes in creating 360° panoramic images and 360° object viewers which can capture large spans of land, showcase a property’s amenities, or highlight features of inventory that you are trying to sell (e.g. a house, a car, farm equipment, and etc.)

Snug Music Lessons

Music Instructor

Started small business in March, 2016, with the aim to promote musical growth for students of all ages by teaching guitar, bass guitar, and piano. Since its birth, its client base grew up to 20 clients within a year and half through ‘word of mouth’ and online advertisement. Duties included crafting weekly agendas tailored to each student’s needs and desires based on their respective musical aspirations while logging their progress via Pro-Tools library, ensuring each student is engaged with their instrument and is goal-oriented within their preferred genres of music while exposing them to new styles of playing, recording students as they perform benchmark pieces from their recital books and give criticism that is equally constructive, critical, and welcoming.
